title: Product Manager - App Ads, Ad Platforms
summary: At Apple, we work every day to build products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and relevant content on their devices while helping developers and publishers promote and monetize their work. Our technology and services power advertising in the App Store and Apple News. Our offline pipelines are highly performant, deployed to handle high-volume asynchronous events at scale, and set new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy! We're looking for a curious, analytical and collaborative technical Product Manager to build advertising solutions with a deep understanding of Apple's values. Product scope can range from evolving the consumer experience for advertising to performance optimization features for advertisers.
description:
-  As a product owner, you'll work across Product, Data Insights, Engineering, Design, Sales and Marketing teams to deliver product specifications that enable near & long-term strategic projects in our App Ads business
-  Define product features and communicate requirements to Engineering teams via clearly written requirements, diagrams and concise verbal communication
-  Work closely with Data Insights and Engineering teams to empower them to identify the critical path, prioritize and deliver upon requirements
-  Synthesize insights from quantitative research, customer meetings and sales feedback to inform product strategy and specifications
-  Collaborate with partner Product Managers, Engineering, and Data Insights teams on feature delivery strategy and plans
preferred_qualifications:
Prior work experience within Ad-Tech or similar domain
MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics or similar fields
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $143,100 and $264,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.
